comments:
Created an attachment (id=75150)
Startup log for run showing problem

Build ID: 200702150621

Steps To Reproduce:
1.Install RSA 7 and upgrade to latest level = 7.0.3
2.Install PDT RC3 (that matches 3.2 eclipse) as example of project that needs a newer WST than IBM provides.  Use links mechanism as the upgrader will fail
3.Install 1.5.5 version of WTP (matches 3.2.2) to satisfy PDT dependencies
4. Note recurring problems per below when PDT calls WST

This is possibly an overall compatability issue.  If the Facets Manager is IBM proprietary then users of the IBM tooling lose the ability to use many Eclipse plugins (PDT is just a useful example) that depend on WST.  

If my analysis is correct, might it be possible to include stub classes for the Facet Manager functionality going forward, so that we are able to proceed.  IBM upgrades verrrrry slowly!

==== Here's the specific exception when PDT validates, calling WST ====

2. Opening a simple PHP file to generate a few errors

============End=================

Facets Manager is part of WTP and is not IBM proprietary. The problem is not due to the ProjectFacetsManager class not being found. It is due to the following failure during that classes's initialization. The failure is the cause stack trace for the first exception:

Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Project facet jsf.base has not
been defined.
        at
org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.internal.ProjectFacetsManagerImpl.getProjectFacet(Unknown
Source)
        at
org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.internal.ProjectFacetsManagerImpl.readConstraintHelper(Unknown
Source)
        at
org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.internal.ProjectFacetsManagerImpl.readConstraintHelper(Unknown
Source)
        at
org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.internal.ProjectFacetsManagerImpl.readConstraint(Unknown
Source)
        at
org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.internal.ProjectFacetsManagerImpl.readMetadata(Unknown
Source)
        at
org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.internal.ProjectFacetsManagerImpl.<init>(Unknown
Source)
        at
org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.FacetedProjectFramework.initialize(Unknown
Source)
        at
org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.FacetedProjectFramework.getProjectFacetsManagerImpl(Unknown
Source)
        at
org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.ProjectFacetsManager.<clinit>(Unknown
Source)
        at java.lang.J9VMInternals.initializeImpl(Native Method)
        ... 16 more

My guess is that you are getting this because when you updated some plugins, some of your existing plugins are no longer activating due to unsatisfied dependencies (this would be the plugins that define the jsf.base facet), but others are still activating (this would be the plugins that reference the jsf.base facet). Basically it doesn't look like you can create the configuration that you are after due to plugin constraints.

You might ask why ProjectFacetsManager is falling down so badly in this case and that's a good question. That bug has recently been fixed for WTP 2.0.1 and 3.0. Note that the fix would not enable the configuration that you are trying to create, you'd just get a more polite error.

https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=186051

Resolving this as invalid since this really isn't an issue with WTP.

causedBy.message: Project facet jsf.base has not been defined.

traces.message: Project facet jsf.base has not been defined.
